data.title: Olympic Trials 2024 Qualifying Standards. Who's Qualified? Here's A List.
data.meta_description: Here are the athletes who have met the qualifying standards for automatic admission to the US Olympic Trials in Eugene, Oregon.
data.text:
The US Olympic Trials will bring the best American track and field athletes to Eugene, Oregon, to compete with the goal of heading to the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Hundreds of athletes across 22 disciplines will compete for spots, and the 2024 Olympic Trials will also serve as the de facto US Track and Field Outdoor Championships.

Subscribe To FloTrack To Watch More Track & Field Meets All Year Long

Qualifying Standards For The US Olympic Trials 2024

Qualifying Standards For The Olympics In Paris 2024

Olympic Trials Schedule 2024. Here's Track And Field Slate

The process for qualifying for the Olympic Trials can be a bit convoluted, but is the plainest terms, the easiest way to secure your spot is to meet the qualifying standards. For example, the qualifying standard for the men's 100m dash is 10.05, thus, any athlete below that time who has declared for the Olympic Trials is automatically qualified.

However, in most cases, not enough athletes meet the minimum qualifying standard to fill out the field, in this case, a world ranking is used to qualify the rest of the athletes for the competition.

With that said, the athletes listed below are only those who have met the qualifying standards for their given discipline, and thus automatically qualified for the US Olympic Trials, which run from June 21-June 30 at Hayward Field in Eugene, Oregon.

Olympic Trials 2024 Qualifiers For Track And Field

What Are The Qualifying Standards For The 2024 U.S. Olympic Trials For Track & Field?

How To Watch The 2024 U.S. Olympic Team Trials – Track & Field

For those in the United States, NBC and its group of networks will provide extensive coverage of the 2024 U.S. Olympic Team Trials for track and field, which will include more than 20 hours of programming (qualifying, semifinals, finals).

Coverage will begin on the USA Network and Peacock on Friday, June 21 at 6:30 p.m. Eastern, and the action will continue at 9 p.m. EDT on NBC and Peacock. Coverage will end on NBC on Sunday, June 30 at 7:30 p.m. EDT.

Broadcast Schedule (All Times Eastern)

Friday, June 21

Finals: USA Network, Peacock (6:30-9 p.m.)

Finals: NBC, Peacock (9-11 p.m.)

Saturday, June 22

Finals: NBC, Peacock (9-11 p.m.)

Sunday, June 23

Finals: NBC, Peacock (8:30-11 p.m.)

Monday, June 24

Finals: NBC, Peacock (8-11 p.m.)

Thursday, June 27

Finals: NBC, Peacock (8-11 p.m.)

Heats: Peacock, 11-11:45 p.m.

Friday, June 28

Finals: USA Network, Peacock (8-10 p.m.)

Finals: NBC, Peacock (10-11 p.m.)

Saturday, June 29

Finals: NBC, Peacock (8-10 p.m.)

Sunday, June 30

Finals: NBC, Peacock (7:30-8:30 p.m.)

Leading up to the 2024 U.S. Olympic Trials and Summer Olympics, and during the competition, FloTrack will provide insight, features, highlights and more.
